result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew P. Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Armed Robbery with Threat of Force

supervisions.notes: $1,625.00 to be paid to Shamaris A.  Joint and several with Kevin Moore 15CF209.

Pay all costs, fees, restitution and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, by DOC out of up to 25% of prison funds and wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
-Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving three (3) years Initial Confinement in this case.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.  Obtain high school diploma or GED.
Mental health assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.
No contact with the coactor:   Kevin Moore,  and victims Rosetta B., Shamaris A. and Brianna W.
Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.

supervisions.notes: Conditions of Extended supervision to be determined by DOC, but to include: those as listed.

Submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms/body armor or weapons.  Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

records.addlTxt:
Certification of SENTENCING HEARING transcript commencing DECEMBER 7, 2015 received and filed. (30 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to INSTITUTION. kl
Signed and filed: Decision and Order Denying Motion to Amend Judgment.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. William S. Pocan, Br. 26, for review. jbs
Defendant's request for CIP/ERP eligibility sooner rather than later.

Defendant Matthew P. Moore in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Defendant Matthew P. Moore in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 7 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 4 years with credit for 0 time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 years.

Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:
 
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with the co-actor:  Kevin Moore and victims:  Rosetta B., Shamaris A., Brianna W.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Restitution is ordered in the amount of $1,625.00 to be paid to Shamaris A., joint and several with Kevin Moore 15CF209.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms/body armour or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs, fees, restitution and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, by DOC out of up to 25% prison funds and wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 3 years initial confinement in this case.


Appeal rights given.
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Defendant Matthew P. Moore in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Defendant Matthew P. Moore in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 3:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 3 dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 4:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    Any restitution will be determined at sentencing.  The defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Matthew P. Moore in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Defendant Matthew P. Moore in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Rudy Gudgeon-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Case is reassigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26 due to co-defendant's lower pending matter.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: BRIANNA W., ROSETTA B.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Matthew P. Moore in court with attorney Jeffery R Schwartz.  
Defendant Matthew P. Moore in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  
State moves to Amend Complaint as to offense dates in Count 3 and 4. No objection from Defense. Court GRANTS State's motion to amend complaint.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
